00004 assembly* load_pdb(char* file_name)
00005 {
00006   char* temp;
00007   WARN=1;SILENT=1;INWC=0;DATE=0;UNCUT=1;UNx=1;UNy=1;UNz=1;
00008   temp = suf; strcpy(temp,".pdb");
00009   temp = sufc; strcpy(temp,"_change.txt"); ACT='0';
00010   DEBUG=-1;LASTRES=-1;LASTOKX=0;LASTOKY=0;LASTOKZ=0;
00011   UNCTOL=0;CRYX=0;CRYY=0;CRYZ=0;LASTX=0;LASTY=0;LASTZ=0;
00012   //int resNum;
00013   int ma;
00014   //molecule* mol;
00015   assembly* asmbl;
00016   IN = myfopen(file_name, "r");
00017  /*scans pdb file for number of lines
00018   allocates memory for line structures
00019   initializes structures that contain line formats*/
00020   init_struct();
00021   rewind(IN);
00022   //Read in lines to ln structure
00023   printf("Reading in %s...\n",file_name);
00024   for(ma=0;ma<INWC;ma++){
00025   if(DEBUG>=1){printf("made it to here main line loop %d ...\n", ma);} 
00026         rwm_line(ma+1);
00027         }
00028   //Determine the number of molecules in the pdb
00029   printf("There are %d molecule(s)\n",howManyMolecules());
00030   asmbl = getAssembly();
00031   printf("PDB Information Successfully Read.\n");
00032   free(ln);
00033   return asmbl;
00034 }
00035 
00036 int howManyMolecules()
00037 {
00038  int i; int counter = 0;
00039 
00040  for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00041   if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)//If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00042    counter++;
00043  if(counter == 0 || isAtom(ln+(INWC-1)) == 1)
00044   counter ++;
00045  return counter;
00046 }

00048 assembly* getAssembly()
00049 {
00050   int molNum = howManyMolecules();
00051   int i = 0;int j = 0;int k = 0;int l = 0;int atom_num;double x,y,z;
00052   char* temp;char name[6] = ""; char* atmName = name;
00053   assembly* asmbl = (assembly*) malloc (1 * sizeof(assembly));
00054   (*asmbl).nm = molNum;
00055   molecule* mol = (molecule*) malloc (molNum * sizeof(molecule));
00056   (*asmbl).m[0] = mol; // changed by BLF on 20080622 -- might need revisiting
00057   molecule* curMol; residue* curRes;// residue* res;
00058   atom* curAtm;// atom* atm;
00059   //Get all the information for the first molecule
00060   curMol = (mol+j);
00061   (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i);
00062   (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00063   getResInfo((*curMol).r,i);
00064   curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00065   (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00066   curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00067   for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00068   {
00069     //If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00070     if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)
00071     {
00072       j++;
00073       curMol = (mol+j);
00074       (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i+1);
00075       (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00076       getResInfo((*curMol).r,i+1);
00077       curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00078       k = 0;l = 0;
00079       (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00080       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00081     }
00082     else if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00083     {
00084       if(l == (*curRes).na)
00085       {
00086        k++;l = 0;
00087        curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00088        (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom)); 
00089        //curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00090       }
00091       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00092       //Getting the atom #
00093       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[1].c;
00094       sscanf(temp,"%d",&atom_num);
00095       //Getting the atom name
00096       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[3].c;
00097       sscanf(temp,"%s",atmName);
00098       //Getting the X coordinate
00099       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[11].c;
00100       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&x);
00101       //Getting the Y coordinate
00102       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[12].c;
00103       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&y);
00104       //Getting the Z coordinate
00105       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[13].c;
00106       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&z);   
00107 
00108       (*curAtm).n = atom_num;//set the atom #
00109       strcpy((*curAtm).N,atmName);//set the atom name
00110       //set the atom's coordinates
00111       (*curAtm).x.i = x; (*curAtm).x.j = y; (*curAtm).x.k = z;
00112       l++;
00113     }
00114   }
00115  return asmbl;
00116 }

00118 int findTotalResidue(int start)
00119 {
00120   int ret = 0;int i = start;int curRes = 0;int thisRes;
00121   char* temp;
00122   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC)
00123   {
00124     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00125     {
00126       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00127       sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00128       if(thisRes != curRes)
00129       { 
00130         ret ++;
00131         curRes = thisRes;
00132       }
00133     }
00134    i++;
00135   }
00136   return ret;
00137 }

00139 int endOfMol(linedef* line)
00140 {
00141   if(((*line).a == 4 && (*line).b == 2)||
00142      ((*line).a == 2 && ((*line).b == 9||(*line).b == 3)))
00143     return 1;
00144   else
00145     return 0;
00146 }
00147 
00148 int isAtom(linedef* line)
00149 {
00150   if(((*line).a == 2 || (*line).a == 3) && (*line).b == 1)
00151     return 1;
00152   else
00153     return 0;
00154 }
00155 void getResInfo(residue* res, int start)
00156 {
00157   int atmTot = 0;int resNum,thisRes;int i = start;int j = 0;
00158   char name [10];char* temp;char* resName = name;
00159   while(isAtom(ln+i) == 0 && i < INWC)
00160    i++;
00161   //Getting the residue name
00162   temp = (*(ln+i)).f[5].c;
00163   sscanf(temp,"%s",resName);
00164   strcpy((*(res+j)).N, resName);
00165   //Getting the residue #
00166   temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00167   sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00168   resNum = thisRes;
00169   (*(res+j)).n = resNum;
00170   i = start;
00171   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC)
00172   {
00173     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00174     {
00175       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00176       sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00177       if(thisRes != resNum)
00178       { 
00179         //Setting the total # of atoms on the old res
00180         resNum = thisRes;
00181         (*(res+j)).na = atmTot;
00182         atmTot = 0; j++;
00183         //Getting the residue name for the new res
00184         temp = (*(ln+i)).f[5].c;
00185         sscanf(temp,"%s",resName);
00186         strcpy((*(res+j)).N, resName);
00187         //Setting the residue # on the new res
00188         (*(res+j)).n = resNum;
00189       }
00190       else
00191         atmTot++;
00192     }
00193    i++;
00194   }
00195  (*(res+j)).na = atmTot;
00196 }
